data.fullContent: The first person to identify the Milky Way galaxy was Galileo. He was the first person to look up into the night sky and see a light in the sky that was not one of the planets or stars. He started to wonder why the light was there. After many years of research, he was able to determine that this light was actually a cluster of small celestial bodies called stars. The Milky Way galaxy is made of billions of stars and is approximately 100,000 light-years in diameter. Today, scientists have used special telescopes to determine that the Milky Way is not the only galaxy in the universe but is just one of billions of galaxies.

q1.translation: 第一个发现银河系的人是伽利略。他是第一个仰望夜空，看到天空中不是行星或恒星的光的人。他开始纳闷为什么会有光。经过多年的研究，他能够确定这些光实际上是一群被称为恒星的小天体。

q2.translation: 第一个发现银河系的人是伽利略。他是第一个仰望夜空，看到天空中不是行星或恒星的光的人。他开始纳闷为什么会有光。经过多年的研究，他能够确定这些光实际上是一群被称为恒星的小天体。银河系由数十亿颗恒星组成，直径约为10万光年。今天，科学家们使用特殊的望远镜来确定银河系不是宇宙中唯一的星系，而是数十亿个星系中的一个。

options.sentence: Galileo Galilei was an Italian astronomer and physicist and the first to observe the moons of Jupiter.
Galileo learned all he could about the stars, but he wanted to know more about how they were made.
The first person to identify the Milky Way galaxy was Galileo, who discovered that it was made of billions of stars.
Galileo's father was a great fan of astronomy, so he encouraged Galileo to learn as much as possible about the stars and the moon.
